contentrichtext.text: '''Karl Zuchardt''' (10 February 1887 – 12 November 1968) was a [[Germany|German]] [[writer]] of [[historical novel]]s. Zuchardt was born in [[Leipzig]], [[Kingdom of Saxony]]. In 1961 he received the [[Martin Andersen NexÃ¸]]-Arts-Award from the city of [[Dresden]], where he later died. Books by Zuchardt include ''Der Spiessrutenlauf'', ''[[Stirb Du Narr!]]'' (an account of [[Sir Thomas More]]'s political life), and ''Wie lange noch [[Napoleon I of France|Bonaparte]]?'' {{Authority control|VIAF=66829782}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Zuchardt, Karl | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = German writer | DATE OF BIRTH = 10 February 1887 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 12 November 1968 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Zuchardt, Karl}} [[Category:1887 births]] [[Category:1968 deaths]] [[Category:People from Leipzig]] [[Category:German historical novelists]] {{Germany-writer-stub}}
